job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: Great work environment; friendly colleagues; diverse student body
cons: Administrative help is lacking for adjuncts; layers of bureaucracy

job_title: Business Associate in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: You'll learn exactly what NOT to do to promote retention and employee engagement. You do get a discount on tuition as an employee.
cons: Learning what NOT to do to promote retention and employee engagement may cost you your sanity. Bullying, gaslighting, exclusion, and harassment are tolerated, and even rewarded when you're friends with the right people. Trust and transparency don't exist. Management and leadership are not concerned with making improvements to the culture. Perhaps it is due to denial, but it seems as if they just don't care how employees feel, what they need, or how they're treated. Staff are expected to live the values listed on the website, but leadership is not, and they don't. Very political, hierarchical, and a lot of bureaucracy.

review_title: Great coworkers, great college, low pay
job_title: Instructional Assistant III in Naperville, IL

cons: The salary grades have been stagnant for a long time, while COD continues to hire additional administrators at the top levels.

review_title: Low to little trust, compensation and opportunities

review_title: Adjunct Faculty for College of Dupage
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: For adjunct faculty, the pay scale is very good.  There are also many training opportunities for professional development.  The technology and resources are easy to access and abundant.
cons: You will never be hired full time--that is the main problem.  There isn't much communication among the departments.  There is resistance to change.  A negative relationship exists between full time faculty and part time.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: This is a nice place to work. The full-time employees got good benefits and time off. Some office positions also get lighter hours during the summer. There is a lot available on campus to change up the day like gym access, a cafeteria, galleries, and other COD events worth checking out on lunch breaks. Most of my contacts from COD still work here and it's not hard to see why. I miss working here and would have stayed if I could have.
cons:
Communication could be bad between divisions and a lot of people didn't know the proper procedures or where to direct people. A small example of this is that I was frequently redirecting calls that had been misdirected to us by other employees at the college. 

Some divisions were run well, others were notoriously hard to deal with. HR was one that struggled with communication and frustrated a lot of other divisions. It could take months to get a response from them. Better communication between divisions is essential for smoother operations.

review_title: College of DuPage Employment Okay During Turmoil
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: The College of DuPage offers a friendly, respectful work environment for full and part-time employees. My supervisors give me the tools and information I need to do my job well. They also trust me and give me ample space to do my job without micromanaging me. I think that because the college has undergone a bad period involving senior management, mid-level supervisors and those on the academic side are trying that much harder to make it a pleasant  working environment for employees.
cons: The college is going through unruly times, and while the academics are solid, there is a feeling of instability that makes most people feel uneasy to some extent.

job_title: Classifed in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: Job security is high here.  You just need to show up to get paid.  They hire people without experience and it's up to you whether you want to get trained or just sit all day and do nothing.  The campus is beautiful and people are happy.  Nobody is disciplined for bad performance.
cons: The pay is extremely low compared to other insititutions.  Pay increases are 3% regardless if you get promoted or transfer to another department.  Employees do not seem to want to learn or think outside of the norm.  Resistance to change is very obvious.  As with most low paying organizations, you get what you pay for - low caliber (unprofessional) people.

job_title: Administrative Assistant III in Westmont, IL
pros: Amazing people!  The center supervisor, Pete Mumford is truly the best manager I've ever had!  He has a laid back management style and makes his employees feel welcome and appreciated.  His assistant Sherry Pacha is a wealth of knowledge and she teams up very well with Pete to give employees and students alike a good experience with the college.  The center is small so the service is much more personal.  Lots of class options available and they have a really great BNA program running out of this center!  If you prefer a more intimate setting for your classes, you will love this center.  And...lots of parking!!  No searching to find a space!
cons: Not much full time work available with the college at the centers off main campus.

review_title: Writing Center Coach - A Good Experience and Interesting Talking Point on My Resume
job_title: Reading and Writing Center Coach in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros:
Friendly atmosphere, rewarding work, and higher pay than other hourly jobs at CoD.

Many appointments are very engaging and you learn a lot from reading other people's papers. You can also build long time rapport with some students that come in frequently and it's very rewarding to see them grow as writers as time passes.
cons:
Had to pay about $250 for a class that would certify you for the job. There are people who completed that class that I don't think should've been hired.

There were occasionally repeat students that were coming in clearly trying to get you to do the work. You just have minimize the actual corrections you do and force them to think about the questions they're asking.

review_title: Great exterior, but declining academic quality and for-profit mentality
job_title: Professor in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: Lots of resources, great teachers, dedicated staff, excellent variety, affordable. This is still one of the best community colleges in the country, and the full time and part time teachers are high quality, as is the curriculum.
cons: Poor relationship to surrounding community, contentious school board, nickle-and-dime attitude towards students, poor graduation/completion rates, out-of-date leadership. Classroom teaching is poorly supported, and online education is a mess.

review_title: Great place if only we had leaders.
job_title: in Naperville, IL
pros: The college of full of great people in all departments. Academic and Student Service staff are really student focused.
cons: Administration tends to do whatever they want regardless of of the effect it has on the people that actually do the work. Full time faculty also feel entitled to whatever they want.

review_title: Arbitrary changes, pay policy violation, and clueless management
job_title: Support Staff in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: If you have kids who are college age, want to further your education, or learn some new skills, you get tuition at 2/3 off the in-district rate.
cons: Senior management has been making changes over the last two years; however, the  changes don't make sense to employees on the front line, because there is no communication about what is happening, nor is there transparency.  Jobs are being changed, but the people whose jobs are changing aren't getting any details.  The start dates of the new positions keep jumping around the calendar and changing.  Promises are not kept, and recently two new support staff employees were brought in at the top of the pay range, making more money than some of us who have been there for a long time in higher positions, and HR is dragging their feet on an equity adjustments, if we get one at all.  Support staff is not valued, and we are treated poorly.  There is an "ignore it and it will go away" mentality at COD when it comes to support staff.

job_title: Psychology Adjunct Instructor in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: I have a passion for teaching in general and research, statistics, abnormal psychology, and most psychological subjects in particular
cons: Working too hard and the compensation is not as it should be.

job_title: IT Programmer in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: Good pay, or it was.  Benefits were great and one does not have to pay into Social Security because you have SURS.
cons: Management is corrupt causing layoffs, firings, targeting of people to be removed, and it strains everyone.  Horrible location for the commute as one has to live so far away to afford a home as Du Page county is so expensive.  IT had been good but the removal of staff, keeping the legacy COBOL staff hinders all.  VPs and Associate VPs hold up everything to keep control making the work and advancement process impossible.  It is sad as the tax payers are owed more.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: There is always someone to talk to when you need a little help. They allow you to take charge of your classroom and curriculum. My department head and the other full-time professors were amazing!
cons: The higher up the chain you go the more you find red tape. While I was there the president of the college was being looked at for imbuement. I think that problem has been corrected but there was a lot of shady stuff coming out and that isn't fair to the staff or students.

review_title: Good School but they don't care about their part time adjuncts.
job_title: Part Time Adjunct Instructor in Glyn Ellen, IN
pros: Great school. They care about our military. Good food!
cons: They only hire part time adjuncts. Limited amount of credits to teach a year. Don't ever expect to be full time here. They couldn't care less about you. No mentors. Not very organized.

review_title: Guess what COD leadership? Employees Matter!!!!!
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: Nice campus with great students. The students are what keeps me motivated.
cons: Negative atmosphere--too many unhappy employees! Working there makes you wonder leadership cares about its employees.   Leaders, please carefully think if you are executing best practices with your valued employees. Are you compensating them fairly? Offering positions with benefits? Responding to them when they apply for an advanced position? Helping them grow to serve the students and the community? I would say there is a huge need to grow in ALL of the areas.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: Nice location, mostly friendly staff and opportunity to move to other departments/positions.
cons: Policies and procedures that go unchecked and aren't updated to reflect current needs/times.   This can encumber progress  and an employees ability to do their job to the best of their ability.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: Professional environment.  New or newly-renovated buildings with technology in the classroom.  Hard-working faculty all aiming for the success of the students.  Excellent academic programs in a huge range of subjects.  Day or evening teaching opportunities.
cons: If a class or program does not get enough enrollment, classes do get cancelled.  There is little to no chance for part-time faculty to move into a full-time teaching position unless someone leaves.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Glen Ellyn, IL
pros: Flexible schedule, opportunities for growth, regular raises, friendly environment, steady workload. I was able to take time off for vacations without any disruption to my work.
cons: Honestly, none. This was the best job I ever had. It would only be a con for someone that likes a rigid schedule and constant supervision- because my job was the opposite of that.

review_title: A friendly place to teach part-time

cons: Part time faculty,depending on department, have to await for schedule each semester so you may or may not get a course to teach every semester, the salary is tough as with all adjunct positions,

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Glen Ellyn, IL

review_title: Great school, great place to work, but not perfect.
